brand.title: Brand Assets
brand.description: Official logos, colors, and brand guidelines for {name}. Free to use for press, partnerships, and community projects.
brand.guideline1: Do not stretch, distort, or rotate the logo
brand.guideline2: Maintain adequate spacing around the logo
brand.guideline3: Use the dark logo on light backgrounds and vice versa
brand.guideline4: Do not add effects like shadows or gradients to the logo
brand.guideline5: The logo should be clearly visible against the background
brand.licenseText: The {name} brand assets are provided under <link>CC0 1.0 Universal</link>. You are free to use these assets for any purpose without attribution.

prompts.title: پرامپت‌ها
prompts.createInfo: این پلتفرم پرامپت‌ها را اجرا نمی‌کند — این یک کتابخانه مبتنی بر جامعه برای اشتراک‌گذاری و کشف پرامپت‌های هوش مصنوعی است. پرامپت خود را اینجا بسازید و دیگران می‌توانند آن را در ابزارهای هوش مصنوعی مورد علاقه خود مانند ChatGPT، Claude، Gemini یا هر LLM دیگری کپی و استفاده کنند.

hfDataStudio.aiPlaceholder: کوئری SQL مورد نیاز را توصیف کنید...

prompts.noPromptsDescription: معیارهای جستجو یا فیلتر خود را تنظیم کنید.

prompts.promptDeletedDescription: This prompt was deleted and is only visible to administrators. It will not appear in searches or public listings.
prompts.delistReasonTooShort: This prompt was automatically delisted because the content is too short. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistReasonNotEnglish: This prompt was automatically delisted because it's not primarily in English. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistReasonLowQuality: This prompt was automatically delisted due to quality issues. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistReasonNotInstruction: This prompt was automatically delisted because it doesn't appear to be an LLM instruction. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistReasonManual: This prompt was manually delisted by an administrator. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistReasonUnknown: This prompt has been delisted. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistOwnerNote: Since this prompt was delisted for quality issues, you can request a review or delete it.

support.title: Support
support.description: Find answers to common questions or get help from our community.

whatIsPrompt.question: What is a prompt?
whatIsPrompt.answer: A prompt is an instruction or input you give to an AI model (like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.) to guide its response. It's essentially how you communicate what you want the AI to do. Well-crafted prompts lead to better, more useful outputs from AI systems.

whyPromptsMatter.question: Why do prompts matter? Can't I just ask the AI anything?
whyPromptsMatter.answer:
While advanced AI models can handle casual questions well, prompts become critical when:

• Using AI via API in applications — you often get only one chance to get it right ("one-shot prompting"), with no back-and-forth dialogue
• Working with smaller, cost-effective models that need more precise instructions
• Building production systems where consistency and reliability matter

Optimized prompts help you get better results, save tokens (and money), and create more reliable AI-powered applications.

whatIsPromptschat.question: What is prompts.chat?
whatIsPromptschat.answer: prompts.chat is a community-driven platform where people share, discover, and collect AI prompts. For over 4 years, users have been sharing their prompt optimization techniques here. The community helps each other improve their prompts and learn new approaches to working with AI systems.

howToUse.question: How do I use prompts from this platform?
howToUse.answer: Simply browse the prompts, find one you like, and copy it. You can then paste it into your preferred AI tool (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.) or use it in your applications via API. Many prompts include variables you can customize before copying.

license.question: Can I use these prompts commercially?
license.answer: Yes! All prompts on prompts.chat are released under the CC0 (Creative Commons Zero) license, which means they are in the public domain. You can use, modify, and distribute them freely for any purpose, including commercial use, without attribution.

selfHost.question: Can I self-host this platform?
selfHost.answer: Absolutely! prompts.chat is fully open source. You can deploy your own private instance for your team or organization. Check out our self-hosting documentation for setup instructions.

verification.question: How can I become a verified user?
verification.answer: Verification is granted by administrators to users who consistently share quality prompts. There are no strict rules — if you contribute valuable prompts to the community, an admin may select you as verified. Focus on creating helpful, well-crafted prompts and the recognition will follow.

aiCredits.question: How do AI preview generation credits work?
aiCredits.answer: Each user receives 3 AI generation credits per day by default. These credits allow you to generate preview images, videos, or audio for your prompts using AI. Administrators can adjust the daily credit limit for individual users if needed.

attribution.question: What if the attribution on a prompt is wrong?
attribution.answer: If you notice incorrect attribution on a prompt (for example, if you're the original author but not credited), please open an issue on our GitHub repository. You can use the form below to submit your issue, and we'll review and correct it as soon as possible.

contact.title: Need More Help?
contact.description: If you couldn't find an answer to your question, fill out the form below and we'll help you on GitHub.

form.title: Issue Title
form.titlePlaceholder: Brief summary of your issue or question
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Please describe your issue or question in detail...

apiKey.title: MCP API Key
apiKey.description: Generate an API key to save prompts via MCP and access your private prompts.
apiKey.keyWarning: Keep this key secret. Anyone with this key can access your private prompts and create prompts on your behalf.
apiKey.noApiKey: You haven't generated an API key yet.
apiKey.regenerateDescription: This will invalidate your current API key. Any MCP clients using the old key will need to be updated.
apiKey.revokeDescription: This will permanently delete your API key. You won't be able to use MCP features that require authentication until you generate a new key.
apiKey.publicByDefaultDescription: When saving prompts via MCP, make them public by default instead of private.

connectedPrompts.title: Prompt Flow
connectedPrompts.description: Some prompts work as multi-step workflows. Connect your prompts to create a sequence.
connectedPrompts.addConnectionDescription: Link this prompt to another prompt with a condition label.
connectedPrompts.addPreviousDescription: Select a prompt that comes before this one in the workflow.
connectedPrompts.addNextDescription: Select a prompt that comes after this one in the workflow.
connectedPrompts.noConnections: No connected prompts yet. Add connections to create a prompt chain.
connectedPrompts.labelPlaceholder: e.g., first frame, next step, after processing...
connectedPrompts.labelHint: Describe the condition or transition between prompts
connectedPrompts.fillAllFields: Please select a prompt and enter a label

promptWritingGuide.title: How to Write Great Prompts
promptWritingGuide.subtitle: Tips, examples, and best practices for creating effective AI prompts

beSpecific.title: Be Specific and Clear
beSpecific.description: Vague prompts lead to vague responses. Specify exactly what you want, including format, length, tone, and any constraints.

provideContext.title: Provide Context
provideContext.description: Give background information that helps the AI understand your needs. Include who, what, why, and for whom.

defineFormat.title: Define the Output Format
defineFormat.description: Specify how you want the response structured: bullet points, paragraphs, code blocks, tables, etc.

setConstraints.title: Set Constraints
setConstraints.description: Include limitations like word count, reading level, things to avoid, or specific requirements to follow.

includeExamples.title: Include Examples
includeExamples.description: Show the AI what good output looks like. Examples help calibrate the response style and quality.

rolePlaying.title: Role-Playing: "Act As" Patterns
rolePlaying.description: One of the most powerful prompting techniques is assigning the AI a specific role or persona. This helps establish expertise, tone, and perspective.

variables.title: Using Variables for Dynamic Prompts
variables.description: Variables make your prompts reusable and customizable. Users can fill in different values each time they use your prompt.
variables.tip1: Use descriptive variable names: '$'{topic} is better than '$'{x}
variables.tip2: Provide sensible defaults for optional values
variables.tip3: Group related variables together in your prompt

structured.title: Structured Prompts (JSON/YAML)
structured.description: Structured prompts use JSON or YAML format to organize complex instructions clearly. They're ideal for multi-step workflows, agents, and detailed configurations.
structured.tip1: Use JSON for programmatic use; YAML for human-readable configs
structured.tip2: Keep nesting shallow (2-3 levels max) for readability
structured.tip3: Include comments in YAML to explain complex sections
structured.tip4: Validate your JSON/YAML syntax before saving

outputOptimization.title: Output Optimization
outputOptimization.description: Guide the AI to produce exactly the format and style you need by being explicit about your requirements.
outputOptimization.lengthExample: "Keep response under 200 words" / "Provide exactly 5 bullet points"
outputOptimization.styleExample: "Use simple language suitable for beginners" / "Be technical and precise"
outputOptimization.contentExample: "Do not include personal opinions" / "Focus only on factual information"

ide.runToPreview: Write code to see the prompt preview
ide.desktopOnlyDescription: The Prompt Builder requires a larger screen to work properly. Please open this page on a desktop or laptop computer.
